Description: Corinthian crouching hare pottery aryballos; almost complete with only part of head missing; no decoration remaining; opening at top of head and pierced behind ear for string.
Excavator/field collector: Excavated by: Sir William Matthew Flinders Petrie
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by the Museum of Fine Arts, Boston. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.

For parallels, see Thasos 2383. For a discussion on Corinthian figured vases, see Böhm, S., Korinthische Figurenvasen: Düfte, Gaben und Symbole, Tübingen 2014, in particular, 83-98, though this piece is not listed.
Bibliographic references: Fairbanks 1928 / Early Vases preceding Athenian Black Figure Ware (p. 122, pl. XXXVII, no. 345)
Robinson 1893 / Catalogue of Greek, Etruscan and Roman Vases (p. 230, no. 156)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GB.272) (phase 3)
Previous owner: Currently owned by: Museum of Fine Arts, Boston
Additional IDs: Miscellaneous number: P.5831 1/2 (Pottery & Porcelain Ledger No.)
